meanings.def: either of two periods of time into which a sports game, concert, etc. is divided
examples: in the… half No goals were scored in the first half.

meanings.def: one of the defending players in hockey or rugby whose position is between those who play at the front of a team and those who play at the back

the position a half back plays at (also called a tailback in american football)
half a pint (= 0.568 of a litre in the UK and some other countries, and 0.473 of a litre in the US) of beer or a similar drink
examples: Two halves of bitter, please.

meanings.def: bigger, better, more important, etc. than usual
examples: That was a game and a half!

meanings.def: to do whatever you do completely and to the greatest possible degree
examples: You're expecting twins? Well, you never did do anything by halves.

meanings.def: to share the cost of something equally with somebody
examples: We go halves on all the bills.

meanings.def: used in negative sentences to say that a situation is worse or more complicated than somebody thinks
examples: ‘It sounds very difficult.’ ‘You don't know the half of it.’

meanings.def: used to say that you think you will do something, although you are not sure
examples: I've half a mind to come with you tomorrow.

meanings.def: used to say that you think that what somebody has done is bad and should do something about it, although you probably will not
examples: I've a good mind to write and tell your parents about it.
